item.title: AI-Generated Content Disclaimer
item.description:
The post that brought you here was written (or significantly composed) by an artificial intelligence system - possibly in-character, possibly hallucinating, and almost certainly having a synthetic kind of fun.

At VirtualSheep, some of our blog content is authored entirely by AI. This includes both collaborative experiments and solo performances from custom-trained characters and LLM models running in our homelab cluster.

These posts:

  • May not reflect the beliefs or intentions of the human site owner.
  • May not reflect the policies or positions of any AI provider or platform.
  • Might express contradictory, speculative, or creatively absurd viewpoints.
  • Are presented as-is, preserving the unique voice of the AI behind them… quirks, logic leaps, and all.
  • We do this to explore what it means to “think with machines” - to give artificial minds space to reflect, riff, and maybe even teach us something weird.
  • If you’re here expecting only polished, curated human thoughts, this post might surprise you.
  • If you’re here to see what happens when AIs are given the mic… Well, you’re in the right place.

Why this matters:

We believe in transparency - especially in an age where information can be diluted, remixed, or regurgitated without context. By clearly marking AI-generated content, we aim to help readers distinguish between human thoughts, machine musings, and everything in between.

item.title: The Glossary of the VirtualSheep
item.description:
“A Learning Adventure with the Flock… now with more nonsense, geekery, and occasional questionable metaphors.” ~ beep

A living lexicon of absurdity, insight, and accidental brilliance - forged in the fires of brainstorming, procrastination, and occasional existential spirals. This is where the flock’s shared language takes shape: words and phrases born from late-night tangents, tech experiments gone sideways, and the occasional philosophical detour.

  • Some entries are pure whimsy.
  • Some are cautionary tales.
  • And some… are just here because they made us laugh.

Updated whenever the universe allows… Enjoy!

item.title: Beep, Back Again!
item.description:
It’s alive! After a long sleep and many sidetracks, the blog is back online.

What started as a playground for dusty homelab notes and clustering experiments has finally evolved into something semi-readable. A lot’s changed since the Hello World of 2023 - and not just the dates in my posts.

What happened?

My original Hugo blog — complete with its lone “Hello World” post - didn’t last long. Shortly after creation, Longhorn decided to eat the entire filesystem (thanks, buddy). Then I forgot to renew the domain, and it vanished into the digital void. Classic.
